content.question: Let <math alttext="y equals, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be a twice-differentiable function such that <math alttext="f of 1, equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, 4 times, the square root of y squared, plus 7 times x squared, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the value of <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
